customer_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC
site_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC

citations.narrative:
Three areas were observed to not be maintained free from edges or points that animals could contact:
-A broken board in the fallow deer pen had a nail sticking up.
-A shelter in the sheep pen had a rusted and rough edge sticking out.
-A panel in the pig's pen had wire panel points sticking out.
Sharp points and rusted edges could injure animals. Ensure that enclosures are well maintained to protect animals from
injury and to contain animals.

The corn crib areas for peafowl have areas of loose wire mesh with edges/points. Loose wire edges/points could injure
peafowl. Ensure that enclosures are free from loose wire and edges that could cause injury.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
One peafowl lacks a perch in it's housing area (east end of the peafowl enclosures). Perching is listed in the facility
enrichment plan for peafowl and is beneficial to promote the ability of perching for peafowl. Ensure that this peacock has
adequate access to a perching area.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
Three areas were observed to not be maintained free from edges or points that animals could contact:  
-A broken board in the fallow deer pen had a nail sticking up. 
-A shelter in the sheep pen had a rusted and rough edge sticking out.  
-A panel in the pig's pen had wire panel points sticking out. 
 
Sharp points and rusted edges could injure animals. Ensure that enclosures are well maintained to protect animals from 
injury and to contain animals. 
3.153(a)(1)(i)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
The corn crib areas for peafowl have areas of loose wire mesh with edges/points. Loose wire edges/points could injure 
peafowl. Ensure that enclosures are free from loose wire and edges that could cause injury. 
3.154(b)  Repeat
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
One peafowl lacks a perch in it's housing area (east end of the peafowl enclosures). Perching is listed in the facility 
enrichment plan for peafowl and is beneficial to promote the ability of perching for peafowl. Ensure that this peacock has 
adequate access to a perching area. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
